Add Wizard is only available when server connection has been set based on the email address entered in the settings. (Disable advanced options in the settings) I/O Device registration is currently off. To continue go to „My SUPLA” at %1$s and enable the Device Add Button.
Welcome to Add I/O Device Wizard which will help you to add a new device to your system in a few simple steps. Press Next to continue. Next START>
*) %1$s network will be used by I/O devices to connect with server. Remember password
Power up your I/O Device and make sure it is configuration mode - the status LED should be flashing rapidly. *Configuration mode is enabled by default on brand new products. It can also be enabled manually by pressing and holding CONFIG button or dimmer knob for around 5s. Press START to start configuration.
The connected Server does not support this function! Before you start, set up your Internet connection with the WiFi also used by the I/O device when connecting with server. WiFi Network is disabled or it is impossible to read its identifier or name! WiFi Network configuration can not be added! Current WiFi Network Data timeout. WiFi Network Scan timeout! I/O Device connection setting timeout! Device Configuration Completion timeout! Basic WiFi Network return timeout! Device registration availability information timeout!
No I/O Devices found! Please check if your I/O Device is ON and in configuration mode.
The settings have been transferred to the I/O device. Device parameters Name Firmware GUID MAC Previous state
Incorrect input parameters! The connected device is not compatible with this Wizard! Connection with the device cannot be set! Configuration Failed! This application is not fully authorized. Go to the Application Manager in the System Settings. Find %1$s app and activate all the required authorizations. Heat Meter Select the z-wave bridge and then the channel you want to configure. Device name Channel number Device id Channel id Software version
Function Caption Device Z-Wave wizard Welcome to the z-wave bridge configuration wizard. It will allow you to connect your z-wave devices to Supla. Tap \"Next\" to continue. It will take a while Before continuing, make sure that all your z-wave devices are online. Pressing \"Next\" will search your z-wave network, which may take from a few seconds to several minutes. Below are the details of the selected channel. Please specify its purpose by selecting the appropriate function. Device response not as expected. Method:%1$s Code:%2$s The channel function change failed. Code %1$s The channel caption change failed. Code %1$s The waiting time for basic channel configuration data has expired. The waiting time for changing the channel function has expired. The waiting time for changing the channel caption has expired. The waiting time for the ID of the assigned z-wave device has expired. The waiting time for the list of z-wave devices has expired. Reset network and settings Add device Delete device Z-wave network Select the z-wave device that will be associated with the Supla channel. Channel Z-Wave device Waiting for button press on the z-wave device. The waiting time for pressing the button has elapsed. Searching the z-wave network to build a list of devices. The waiting time to remove the device has expired. Waiting for confirmation of resetting the z-wave network together with clearing the settings. The waiting time for the z-wave network reset has expired. The waiting time for the z-wave device assignment to the channel has elapsed. The z-wave bridge is not responding. Check if the bridge is connected to the server. Waiting for the device to be added to the z-wave network. The waiting time for adding the device to the z-wave network has expired. Are you sure you want to reset the settings and z-wave network? Offline ? Assigned to: The selected z-wave device is already associated with another channel. Are you sure you want to move this device to this channel? Press back to return to the previous step or \"Exit\" to finish. This function is not available when the bridge is in slave mode. Done! Now you can finish the configuration process by pressing \"OK\" or you can press back to configure the next channel or change existing settings.
Are you sure you want to restore the default settings? You cannot change the function of a channel that belongs to a group. You cannot change the function of a channel that has a schedule. Arithmetic balance - Minutes Arithmetic balance - Hours Arithmetic balance - Days Arithmetic balance - Months Arithmetic balance - Years Vector balance - Minutes Vector balance - Hours Vector balance - Days Vector balance - Months Vector balance - Years Wheel Slider
Dimming mode AUTO MODE 1 MODE 2 MODE 3 YES NO Operating range Boost
Information Dimmer control Control the dimmer by moving the control button on the brightness slider / wheel. Switch on and off by tapping the on/off button. The dimmer will remember the previous brightness setting. Tap the config icon to adjust dimming settings. Dimming Mode / Operating Range Fine tune the performance of your LED lights by selecting a different dimming mode or change the operating range by moving the dark grey sliders around the wheel to adjust the minimum and maximum brightness levels. Mode 1: V-Pro Trailing-Edge Dimming Mode 2: Leading-Edge Dimming Mode 3: Alternative Trailing-Edge Dimming Boost This feature helps LED lamps switch on at low brightness settings by providing an initial boost. Move the dark grey slider around the wheel to increase the boost level at switch-on, indicated by the green line. After the boost the brightness will return to the previously set level. More information on can be found at https://www.varilight.co.uk/vps001
Time exceeded. Try again.

Roof window opening sensor Roof window Roof window operation Roof window opening sensor opened / closed the roof window
Status LED The LED is on if there is a connection to the server. The LED is off if there is a connection to the server. The LED is always off, unless the device is in wifi configuration mode (AP Mode). Input Monostable Bistable The attempt to establish a WiFi connection with the i/o device has failed. Change the operating range by moving the dark grey sliders around the wheel to adjust the minimum and maximum brightness levels. Input options This option changes the behavior of the input to which the monostable button is connected. In case the option is disabled, the dimmer stops brightening the light when the full brightness level is reached and in case of dimming, at the lowest brightness level. Enabling this option will switch to the minimum level as soon as the maximum brightness is reached, and in the case of dimming to the maximum value, as soon as the minimum is reached. Brightening / dimming will continue as long as the button is pressed. The option changes the behavior of the dimmer when the lighting is turned on by using the bistable button. If the option is enabled, the dimmer will set the full brightness level right after turning on the lighting. If the option is disabled, the dimmer will set the brightness level saved before turning off the lighting. Digiglass Digiglass The glass sections are exposed for more than 20 hours, which may adversely affect their life. It is recommended to cover all sections for a minimum of 4 hours in order to regenerate them. Planned regeneration is in progress. Regeneration initiated after 20 hours of operation is in progress. If your new I/O device fails to appear in the Supla app please run “Add I/O Device” wizard again and refer to the “Previous State” information on this page for troubleshooting. “SSID Not Found” is displayed when the chosen 2.4Ghz network is ether not in range or its name was incorrect.
